comment.author: 30083618@N00
comment._content:
Museum never looked so good.

And the links back to Photo Investigator are good value. Great stuff.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [June 2011 - this photo is the subject of the State Records NSW 'Moments in Time' blog - see archivesoutside.records.nsw.gov.au/can-you-date-this-phot... ] That style of lamp post on the left was first introduced in 1912 - see www.cityofsydney.nsw.gov.au/history/sydneystreets/Minding...

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: No Museum Station.   Therefore prior to about 1922  when construction started for Museum Station.   No ANZAC Monument ( completed 1934 ).

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: On May 4 1912,   Samuel Freshman was fined 20 pounds for impersonating Dr Geo J Walsh, of 251 Elizabeth Street.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The large white building is the T & G Insurance Ltd.   A later building was built by the same company on the site in about 1978.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The version of the T&G building in this photo appears to be the same building as in the State Library's 1919 photo.    However by 1934,  it appears to have been rebuilt or very substantially modified.     So the 1978 version may be the third T&G building on that site.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The synagogue is visible on the other side of park street.
